intro: Bidens exilis, commonly known as the slender tickseed, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant features slender, branching stems and small, yellow-orange flowers with distinctive white ray florets. Its leaves are narrow and slightly hairy, often with a serrated edge. Bidens exilis is often found in moist habitats such as wetlands and along streambanks.
